quiz.title: Chemistry Grade 12: Unit 5 Quiz 10
quiz.subtitle: 5.10: Phenols Reactions
quiz.subject: Chemistry
quiz.topic: Electrophilic substitution and specialized name reactions

questions.question: How does the hydroxyl group ($-OH$) influence the reactivity of the benzene ring toward electrophiles?
options: It is strongly activating and ortho/para-directing
It is strongly deactivating and meta-directing
It is weakly activating and meta-directing
It does not affect the reactivity of the ring
questions.explanation: The lone pairs on the oxygen are delocalized into the ring, increasing electron density at the ortho and para positions, making phenol much more reactive than benzene.

questions.question: When phenol reacts with bromine water ($Br_{2}/H_{2}O$) at room temperature, what is the major product?
questions.explanation: Phenol is so reactive that it undergoes trisubstitution even without a Lewis acid catalyst, forming a characteristic white precipitate.

questions.question: What are the products of the reaction between phenol and dilute $HNO_{3}$ at low temperature?
options: A mixture of o-nitrophenol and p-nitrophenol
questions.explanation: Dilute nitric acid at low temperature leads to mononitration at the ortho and para positions due to the activating nature of the $-OH$ group.

questions.question: Which reaction is used to synthesize Salicylic acid from Phenol and $CO_{2}$?
questions.explanation: In the Kolbe-Schmitt reaction, sodium phenoxide reacts with carbon dioxide under pressure, followed by acidification, to yield salicylic acid.

questions.question: The Reimer-Tiemann reaction converts phenol into Salicylaldehyde using which reagents?
questions.explanation: This reaction introduces an aldehyde group ($-CHO$) at the ortho position using chloroform and a strong base.

questions.question: Phenol reacts with Zinc dust upon heating to produce:
questions.explanation: Heating phenol with Zinc dust results in deoxygenation (reduction), stripping the $-OH$ group to form benzene and $ZnO$.

questions.question: Oxidation of phenol with chromic acid ($Na_{2}Cr_{2}O_{7}/H_{2}SO_{4}$) produces which conjugated diketone?
questions.explanation: Phenols are easily oxidized to quinones, which are highly colored compounds.

questions.question: Which of the following describes 'Aspirin' in relation to phenol derivatives?
options: It is the acetylated derivative of salicylic acid
It is pure phenol in tablet form
It is a polymer of phenol and formaldehyde
It is a nitrate ester of phenol
questions.explanation: Aspirin (acetylsalicylic acid) is synthesized by reacting salicylic acid (made from phenol) with acetic anhydride.

questions.question: What is the result of reacting phenol with concentrated $H_{2}SO_{4}$ at $100^{\circ}C$?
questions.explanation: At higher temperatures, the para isomer is favored as it is the more thermodynamically stable product.

questions.question: Why is it possible to separate o-nitrophenol from p-nitrophenol using steam distillation?
options: o-nitrophenol has intramolecular hydrogen bonding and is more volatile
p-nitrophenol is a gas at room temperature
o-nitrophenol is more soluble in water
p-nitrophenol has a lower molar mass
questions.explanation: Intramolecular H-bonding in the ortho isomer reduces its ability to H-bond with water or other molecules, making it steam-volatile compared to the para isomer.
